stimulusHtml:
The work shown is Claude Monet’s The Saint-Lazare Station, painted in Paris in 1877 C.E. In this painting, Monet responded to changes in modern Parisian life.

Describe at least two specific changes that transformed life in Paris at the time Monet painted The Saint-Lazare Station.

Using specific visual and contextual evidence, analyze how Monet responded to these changes that transformed life in Paris.

Explain how Monet conveyed an attitude about modern Parisian life in the painting.
